roleset.name: (cause) two things to intersect

example.name: ergative
example.text: He adds: ``[The medical market and the fitness market]-1 parallel each other and are going *trace*-1 to cross real soon.''

example.name: agentive
example.text: When Mr. Glass decides to get really fancy, he crosses his hands and hits a resonant bass note with his right hand.

roleset.note:
CROSS-V NOTES: Frames file for 'cross' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 40.3.2 and 47.8; Framenet entries Body_movement and Path_shape. (from cross.01-v)
CROSSING-N NOTES: cross.01 (from crossing.01-n)

roleset.name: move perpendicularly to some barrier

example.name: most obvious usage
example.text: Cartoonist Garry Trudeau is suing the Writers Guild of America East for $11 million, alleging it mounted a ``campaign to harass and punish'' him-1 for *trace*-1 crossing a screenwriters' picket line.

example.name: source adverbial
example.text: South Africa accused [armed Namibian nationalist guerrillas]-1 of *trace*-1 crossing from bases in neighboring Angola, violating U.N.-supervised peace plans for the territory's independence from Pretoria.
example.arg: violating U.N.-supervised peace plans for the territory's independence from Pretoria

example.name: destinatino adverbial
example.text: In a sign of easing tension between Beijing and Hong Kong, China said it will again take back [illegal immigrants]-1 caught *trace*-1 *trace*-1 crossing into the British colony.

example.name: barrier as path over barrier
example.text: Although one transportation official said drivers who didn't use car pools were committing ``an anti-social act,'' about two-thirds of the motorists crossing the Golden Gate were alone, compared with the normal 70% rate.

example.name: unstated barrier
example.text: About 130,000 vehicles cross during a 24-hour period.

roleset.note:
CROSS-V NOTES: (from cross.02-v)
CROSSING-N NOTES: cross.02 (from crossing.02-n)

roleset.name: eliminate from a list

example.name: all args
example.text: If Colgate toothpaste offers a tempting money-saving coupon, she'll cross Crest off her shopping list without a second thought.
example.arg: If Colgate toothpaste offers a tempting money-saving coupon

example.name: unstated list
example.text: As each animal entered the Ark, John crossed it off.
example.arg: As each animal entered the Ark

roleset.note:
CROSS-V NOTES: This is weird, but avoids adding a phrasal verb with the exact same framing. (from cross.04-v)
CROSSING-N NOTES: cross.04 (from crossing.04-n)

roleset.name: make angry

example.name: an unfortunate example
example.text: In testimony recorded in the grand jury report, court employees said the judge, now 59 years old, harassed his secretaries, made imperial demands on his staff and hounded anyone who *trace* crossed him.

roleset.note:
CROSS-V NOTES: This seems contrived to me, but I can't figure out any better way tohandle the example. (from cross.05-v)
CROSSING-N NOTES: cross.05 (from crossing.05-n)

roleset.name: eliminate

example.name: zap!
example.text: Mr. Guber says he had crossed out ``MGM'' with a red pen and written in ``Columbia,'' giving the document to Mr. Semel.

roleset.note:
CROSS_OUT-V NOTES: (from cross.03-v)
CROSSING_OUT-N NOTES: cross.03 (from crossing.03-n)
